Two graduate students joined Reisz’s lab at UTM this September, and four undergraduate students are working in the lab this year. In winter 2023, Reisz is scheduled to teach two courses at UTM: BIO354 and BIO356.

Of the numerous incidents reported by Haridy, U of T concluded that only the one where Reisz asked her for a hug amounted to a violation of the university’s sexual harassment policy. In another incident she reported, Reisz referred to her as "babe" in an email.
The spokesperson further wrote, “The faculty member is permitted to work with, supervise and mentor students.”

A U of T spokesperson wrote, “The university determined that on a number of occasions the faculty member’s supervisory practices did not meet the standards expected of a University of Toronto faculty member and/or breached university policy.”
Following Bryan Gee and Yara Haridy's 72-page report of sexual and racial harassment and supervisory misconduct, U of T commissioned an external investigation into Reisz's misconduct.
INVESTIGATION: In January, an external investigation commissioned by U of T found that UTM Professor Robert Reisz violated U of T's sexual harassment policy. https://t.co/zr83DzYuBH
